Title: EP. REVIEW: Teasing Master Takagi-san Season 3 [1/2] - Forum - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: ×  remind me tomorrow remind me next week never remind me      Subscribe to the ANN Newsletter • Wake up every Sunday to a curated list of ANN's most interesting posts of the week.    read more           ข่าวสารและบทความของ Anime News Network ในรูปแบบภาษาไทย สามารถติดตามอ่านได้แล้วที่ DEXclub         กรุณาเข้าไปเยี่ยมชมได้ที่ news.dexclub.com เพื่อติดตามอ่านข่าวสารล่าสุดในรูปแบบภาษาไทย          Anime News Network's news and articles are available in Thai from DEXclub.         Visit news.dexclub.com for all the latest news in Thai.              Forum - View topicEP. REVIEW: Teasing Master Takagi-san Season 3            Goto page 1, 2  Next Note: this is the discussion thread for this article     Anime News Network Forum Index -> Site-related -> Talkback    View previous topic :: View next topic     Author Message        earl.m            Posted: Mon Jan 24, 2022 3:08 pm            I have a more negative view of Takagi's actions than most people. In addition to gaslighting Nishikata, teasing him with her body, prodding him on his insecurities, invading his privacy (i.e. concerning hobbies and activities of his that he wants to keep secret) and other things that could easily be perceived as harassment and manipulation were the writing, directing, animation etc. willing to depict it as such instead of framing it as harmless and cute, we can't ignore that Takagi fully knows what she is doing. She is romantically interested in Nishikata, and her antics are part of her long-game play to get him to reciprocate. Takagi exploits the immature male's social tendencies - i.e. competitiveness, honor/shame etc. - in order to get him thinking about her all the time, become fascinated with her, want to spend more time with her etc. It significantly increases the amount of attention that Nishikata - who left to his own devices would have little interest in girls beyond casual acquaintance/friendship level, let alone romance (he doesn't even participate in the venerable male anime character traditions of owning swimsuit magazines or trying to catch a glance at the girls at the swimming pool) - pays to her. Most important: it keeps Nishikata's focus trained solely on her rather than potentially on other girls. spoiler[This is significant because manga readers know that Takagi's actions had their intended effect: down the line Nishikata marries her without having so much as ever dated anybody else.]   I should point out: it isn't that I care about any of the issues that I am raising. After all, I love this show. But I also like the other "imitators" whose female protagonists get criticized for doing the same thing that Takagi does, with Don't Bully Me Miss Nagatoro and Uzaki Chan Wants to Hang Out among them. In a way, the other oft-criticized imitators are worse. In contrast with Takagi, Uzaki rarely ever actually intends to harass Shinichi and certainly isn't trying to dominate his attention. Instead it happens mostly by accident as a result of Uzaki - not the sharpest tack in the drawer - acting on impulse without thinking. Nagatoro and her crew only started bullying the nameless MC because they saw him judgmentally eye them, try to avoid them and then he dropped his comic drawings, which revealed that - as they had already guessed by the way that he was looking at and trying to avoid them - he possessed retrograde opinions of women. Not saying that misogynists deserve to be teased, but merely pointing out that Nishikata is a decent fellow who in no way deserves his treatment. The opposite is true - Takagi teases Nishikata BECAUSE he is a decent fellow as it is why she likes him. The problem: her teasing him is conditioning him to like her back.    One is probably thinking: big deal, Nishikata gets attention from a cute girl - and down the line a girlfriend (no reason to treat it as a spoiler ... a shonen gag comedy about middle schoolers isn't doing 3 seasons and a movie just pull Five Centimeters Per Second on us) - out of the deal. But shouldn't Takagi get to have agency in his romantic choices instead of being deprived of it by Takagi's premeditated machinations? Nishikata's lacking Nagatoro's hard edge - and Uzaki's figure - shouldn't exempt her behavior from scrutiny.      Back to top                all-tsun-and-no-dere  		     		    ANN Reviewer  Joined: 06 Jul 2015 		    Posts: 446       Posted: Mon Jan 24, 2022 11:38 pm            Sir this is a Wendy's      Back to top                  TarsTarkas    Joined: 20 Dec 2007 		    Posts: 5253 		    Location: Virginia, United States 		        Posted: Tue Jan 25, 2022 2:47 am              earl.m wrote:    But shouldn't Takagi get to have agency in his romantic choices instead of being deprived of it by Takagi's premeditated machinations?            Whether you are a man or a woman, both have to get their intended love interest, interested in them.  Chasing after your intended choice, the ultimate goal, for everyone living, is to get them to have eyes only for you.   He isn't being drugged and he is not imprisoned.  He has his agency.  In today's cultural minefields I can see why some might not like her actions, but I am not one of them.     Quote:    “The rules of fair play do not apply in love and war.” John Lyly               Back to top                  Kirki    Joined: 11 Jun 2019 		    Posts: 201       Posted: Wed Jan 26, 2022 1:53 am            I'm confused, you're describing 'flirting' and portraying it as manipulation and a bad thing. Takagi's 'teasing' is the most harmless and innocent thing. Yes, she's more clever than Nishikata and knows how to deal with him so she always 'wins', but in the end of the day it's just two middle-school kids with a crush playing with each other.      Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Tue Feb 01, 2022 12:40 am            I love how much more obvious the pairs' relationship and feelings get by the episode, especially on Takagi's side. To the point where we even get a segment of no teasing in the UFO story where it's just the two of them hanging out and goofing around like an actual couple.    Also, Nishikata won! Of course, he didn't realize it.      Back to top                  Beltane70    Joined: 07 May 2007 		    Posts: 3178       Posted: Tue Feb 01, 2022 9:04 am            I have to say that my favorite part of the episode was seeing Takagi dressed as Lum from Urusei Yatsura during the UFO sequence!      Back to top                    Amuro1X    Joined: 02 Sep 2009 		    Posts: 120       Posted: Fri Feb 04, 2022 5:35 pm            spoiler[Chi-chan showed up this episode!!!]      Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Mon Feb 07, 2022 3:02 pm            I was really confused by the opening segment until we saw adult Takagi and it turned out we were watching their kid who is going through her own variant of her parents' romance arc (only she's in the Nishikata position).   I love how Takagi's mask is dropping more and more. Like, she wanted Nishikata to be her prince only for his performance to actually take her breath away. And then look at her reaction when she has to hug Nishikata to prevent him from falling and realizes what she'd done.      Back to top                  Minos_Kurumada    Joined: 04 Nov 2015 		    Posts: 491       Posted: Mon Feb 07, 2022 3:25 pm            The thing with Chi is that the manga already presented her waaaaaaay back in chapter 31 in a flashforward, the series end has never been an spoiler and the whole thing is written with the premise of you knowing what's going to happen.   That's an special episode to celebrate Tagaki going into a more popular magazine, it's quite good since it's designed to tease the reader not Nishikata.      Back to top                  Moonsaber    Joined: 16 Jan 2007 		    Posts: 316 		    Location: USA 		        Posted: Mon Feb 07, 2022 4:17 pm              earl.m wrote:     <snip>             It's an anime, wow.  Watch something else if it triggers you.   In the meantime...   CHI-CHAN!  CHI-CHAN!    So happy to see her show up, and I want more of her.      Back to top                    dm   Subscriber   Joined: 24 Sep 2010 		    Posts: 952       Posted: Mon Feb 07, 2022 5:18 pm            So that's what that opening was.   At first I thought "kind of off-model this week", then I thought "This must be some anime Nishikata is watching with role-reversal, I wonder if he's going to try to work the green pepper thing into a revenge plot...", then I forgot about it as the episode went on.      Back to top                  Northlander    Joined: 10 Feb 2009 		    Posts: 874       Posted: Mon Feb 14, 2022 12:51 pm              Kirki wrote:    I'm confused, you're describing 'flirting' and portraying it as manipulation and a bad thing. Takagi's 'teasing' is the most harmless and innocent thing. Yes, she's more clever than Nishikata and knows how to deal with him so she always 'wins', but in the end of the day it's just two middle-school kids with a crush playing with each other.           She did actually "lose" once, in the first season. Nishikata just didn't notice it.   Can't speak for the following two, since I don't have access to those. Bluray release, stat!      Back to top                    Amuro1X    Joined: 02 Sep 2009 		    Posts: 120       Posted: Mon Feb 14, 2022 1:09 pm            I don't know if I'll be able to freaking handle it if Former Teasing Master Takagi ever gets an anime.      Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Tue Feb 15, 2022 12:13 am            I think everyone had it pegged that Nishikata would eventually end up the prince, but him pulling a diving save on Takagi with some solid improve was great...and Takagi herself dropping the acting and basically just genuinely confessing to him was perfect.    And that was after we saw her looking at him for all her romantic dialogue, because she was intending it for him.    Just a really beautiful and fun episode.      Back to top                  dm   Subscriber   Joined: 24 Sep 2010 		    Posts: 952       Posted: Sat Feb 19, 2022 1:05 pm            Episode seven   Walking the dog: Nishikata as tsundere.    However, I'm afraid that I thought the schtick had run its course a short way into the "return to school" part of the episode.  Time to just own up to what's happening Nishikata.  Maybe he needs to be teased for not having a girlfriend yet in order to readjust his behavior?   Kaguya-sama, Love is war showed that there is life after the confession, after all.... Maybe he needs to be teased for not having a girlfriend yet in order to readjust his behavior?   Kaguya-sama, Love is war showed that there is life after the confession, after all.... Title: EP. REVIEW: Teasing Master Takagi-san Season 3 [1/2] - Forum - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: Goto page 1, 2  Next Note: this is the discussion thread for this article     Anime News Network Forum Index -> Site-related -> Talkback    View previous topic :: View next topic     Author Message        earl.m            Posted: Mon Jan 24, 2022 3:08 pm            I have a more negative view of Takagi's actions than most people. In addition to gaslighting Nishikata, teasing him with her body, prodding him on his insecurities, invading his privacy (i.e. concerning hobbies and activities of his that he wants to keep secret) and other things that could easily be perceived as harassment and manipulation were the writing, directing, animation etc. willing to depict it as such instead of framing it as harmless and cute, we can't ignore that Takagi fully knows what she is doing. She is romantically interested in Nishikata, and her antics are part of her long-game play to get him to reciprocate. Takagi exploits the immature male's social tendencies - i.e. competitiveness, honor/shame etc. - in order to get him thinking about her all the time, become fascinated with her, want to spend more time with her etc. It significantly increases the amount of attention that Nishikata - who left to his own devices would have little interest in girls beyond casual acquaintance/friendship level, let alone romance (he doesn't even participate in the venerable male anime character traditions of owning swimsuit magazines or trying to catch a glance at the girls at the swimming pool) - pays to her. Most important: it keeps Nishikata's focus trained solely on her rather than potentially on other girls. spoiler[This is significant because manga readers know that Takagi's actions had their intended effect: down the line Nishikata marries her without having so much as ever dated anybody else.]   I should point out: it isn't that I care about any of the issues that I am raising. After all, I love this show. But I also like the other "imitators" whose female protagonists get criticized for doing the same thing that Takagi does, with Don't Bully Me Miss Nagatoro and Uzaki Chan Wants to Hang Out among them. In a way, the other oft-criticized imitators are worse. In contrast with Takagi, Uzaki rarely ever actually intends to harass Shinichi and certainly isn't trying to dominate his attention. Instead it happens mostly by accident as a result of Uzaki - not the sharpest tack in the drawer - acting on impulse without thinking. Nagatoro and her crew only started bullying the nameless MC because they saw him judgmentally eye them, try to avoid them and then he dropped his comic drawings, which revealed that - as they had already guessed by the way that he was looking at and trying to avoid them - he possessed retrograde opinions of women. Not saying that misogynists deserve to be teased, but merely pointing out that Nishikata is a decent fellow who in no way deserves his treatment. The opposite is true - Takagi teases Nishikata BECAUSE he is a decent fellow as it is why she likes him. The problem: her teasing him is conditioning him to like her back.    One is probably thinking: big deal, Nishikata gets attention from a cute girl - and down the line a girlfriend (no reason to treat it as a spoiler ... a shonen gag comedy about middle schoolers isn't doing 3 seasons and a movie just pull Five Centimeters Per Second on us) - out of the deal. But shouldn't Takagi get to have agency in his romantic choices instead of being deprived of it by Takagi's premeditated machinations? Nishikata's lacking Nagatoro's hard edge - and Uzaki's figure - shouldn't exempt her behavior from scrutiny.      Back to top                all-tsun-and-no-dere  		     		    ANN Reviewer  Joined: 06 Jul 2015 		    Posts: 446       Posted: Mon Jan 24, 2022 11:38 pm            Sir this is a Wendy's      Back to top                  TarsTarkas    Joined: 20 Dec 2007 		    Posts: 5253 		    Location: Virginia, United States 		        Posted: Tue Jan 25, 2022 2:47 am              earl.m wrote:    But shouldn't Takagi get to have agency in his romantic choices instead of being deprived of it by Takagi's premeditated machinations?            Whether you are a man or a woman, both have to get their intended love interest, interested in them.  Chasing after your intended choice, the ultimate goal, for everyone living, is to get them to have eyes only for you.   He isn't being drugged and he is not imprisoned.  He has his agency.  In today's cultural minefields I can see why some might not like her actions, but I am not one of them.     Quote:    “The rules of fair play do not apply in love and war.” John Lyly               Back to top                  Kirki    Joined: 11 Jun 2019 		    Posts: 201       Posted: Wed Jan 26, 2022 1:53 am            I'm confused, you're describing 'flirting' and portraying it as manipulation and a bad thing. Takagi's 'teasing' is the most harmless and innocent thing. Yes, she's more clever than Nishikata and knows how to deal with him so she always 'wins', but in the end of the day it's just two middle-school kids with a crush playing with each other.      Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Tue Feb 01, 2022 12:40 am            I love how much more obvious the pairs' relationship and feelings get by the episode, especially on Takagi's side. To the point where we even get a segment of no teasing in the UFO story where it's just the two of them hanging out and goofing around like an actual couple.    Also, Nishikata won! Of course, he didn't realize it.      Back to top                  Beltane70    Joined: 07 May 2007 		    Posts: 3178       Posted: Tue Feb 01, 2022 9:04 am            I have to say that my favorite part of the episode was seeing Takagi dressed as Lum from Urusei Yatsura during the UFO sequence!      Back to top                    Amuro1X    Joined: 02 Sep 2009 		    Posts: 120       Posted: Fri Feb 04, 2022 5:35 pm            spoiler[Chi-chan showed up this episode!!!]      Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Mon Feb 07, 2022 3:02 pm            I was really confused by the opening segment until we saw adult Takagi and it turned out we were watching their kid who is going through her own variant of her parents' romance arc (only she's in the Nishikata position).   I love how Takagi's mask is dropping more and more. Like, she wanted Nishikata to be her prince only for his performance to actually take her breath away. And then look at her reaction when she has to hug Nishikata to prevent him from falling and realizes what she'd done.      Back to top                  Minos_Kurumada    Joined: 04 Nov 2015 		    Posts: 491       Posted: Mon Feb 07, 2022 3:25 pm            The thing with Chi is that the manga already presented her waaaaaaay back in chapter 31 in a flashforward, the series end has never been an spoiler and the whole thing is written with the premise of you knowing what's going to happen.   That's an special episode to celebrate Tagaki going into a more popular magazine, it's quite good since it's designed to tease the reader not Nishikata.      Back to top                  Moonsaber    Joined: 16 Jan 2007 		    Posts: 316 		    Location: USA 		        Posted: Mon Feb 07, 2022 4:17 pm              earl.m wrote:     <snip>             It's an anime, wow.  Watch something else if it triggers you.   In the meantime...   CHI-CHAN!  CHI-CHAN!    So happy to see her show up, and I want more of her.      Back to top                    dm   Subscriber   Joined: 24 Sep 2010 		    Posts: 952       Posted: Mon Feb 07, 2022 5:18 pm            So that's what that opening was.   At first I thought "kind of off-model this week", then I thought "This must be some anime Nishikata is watching with role-reversal, I wonder if he's going to try to work the green pepper thing into a revenge plot...", then I forgot about it as the episode went on.      Back to top                  Northlander    Joined: 10 Feb 2009 		    Posts: 874       Posted: Mon Feb 14, 2022 12:51 pm              Kirki wrote:    I'm confused, you're describing 'flirting' and portraying it as manipulation and a bad thing. Takagi's 'teasing' is the most harmless and innocent thing. Yes, she's more clever than Nishikata and knows how to deal with him so she always 'wins', but in the end of the day it's just two middle-school kids with a crush playing with each other.           She did actually "lose" once, in the first season. Nishikata just didn't notice it.   Can't speak for the following two, since I don't have access to those. Bluray release, stat!      Back to top                    Amuro1X    Joined: 02 Sep 2009 		    Posts: 120       Posted: Mon Feb 14, 2022 1:09 pm            I don't know if I'll be able to freaking handle it if Former Teasing Master Takagi ever gets an anime.      Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Tue Feb 15, 2022 12:13 am            I think everyone had it pegged that Nishikata would eventually end up the prince, but him pulling a diving save on Takagi with some solid improve was great...and Takagi herself dropping the acting and basically just genuinely confessing to him was perfect.    And that was after we saw her looking at him for all her romantic dialogue, because she was intending it for him.    Just a really beautiful and fun episode. In addition to gaslighting Nishikata, teasing him with her body, prodding him on his insecurities, invading his privacy (i.e. concerning hobbies and activities of his that he wants to keep secret) and other things that could easily be perceived as harassment and manipulation were the writing, directing, animation etc. willing to depict it as such instead of framing it as harmless and cute, we can't ignore that Takagi fully knows what she is doing. She is romantically interested in Nishikata, and her antics are part of her long-game play to get him to reciprocate. Takagi exploits the immature male's social tendencies - i.e. competitiveness, honor/shame etc. - in order to get him thinking about her all the time, become fascinated with her, want to spend more time with her etc. It significantly increases the amount of attention that Nishikata - who left to his own devices would have little interest in girls beyond casual acquaintance/friendship level, let alone romance (he doesn't even participate in the venerable male anime character traditions of owning swimsuit magazines or trying to catch a glance at the girls at the swimming pool) - pays to her. Most important: it keeps Nishikata's focus trained solely on her rather than potentially on other girls. spoiler[This is significant because manga readers know that Takagi's actions had their intended effect: down the line Nishikata marries her without having so much as ever dated anybody else.]   I should point out: it isn't that I care about any of the issues that I am raising. After all, I love this show. But I also like the other "imitators" whose female protagonists get criticized for doing the same thing that Takagi does, with Don't Bully Me Miss Nagatoro and Uzaki Chan Wants to Hang Out among them. In a way, the other oft-criticized imitators are worse. In contrast with Takagi, Uzaki rarely ever actually intends to harass Shinichi and certainly isn't trying to dominate his attention. Instead it happens mostly by accident as a result of Uzaki - not the sharpest tack in the drawer - acting on impulse without thinking. Nagatoro and her crew only started bullying the nameless MC because they saw him judgmentally eye them, try to avoid them and then he dropped his comic drawings, which revealed that - as they had already guessed by the way that he was looking at and trying to avoid them - he possessed retrograde opinions of women. Not saying that misogynists deserve to be teased, but merely pointing out that Nishikata is a decent fellow who in no way deserves his treatment. The opposite is true - Takagi teases Nishikata BECAUSE he is a decent fellow as it is why she likes him. The problem: her teasing him is conditioning him to like her back.    One is probably thinking: big deal, Nishikata gets attention from a cute girl - and down the line a girlfriend (no reason to treat it as a spoiler ... a shonen gag comedy about middle schoolers isn't doing 3 seasons and a movie just pull Five Centimeters Per Second on us) - out of the deal. REVIEW: Love of Kill            Goto page 1, 2, 3  Next Note: this is the discussion thread for this article     Anime News Network Forum Index -> Site-related -> Talkback    View previous topic :: View next topic     Author Message        zztop    Joined: 28 Aug 2014 		    Posts: 560       Posted: Tue Jan 18, 2022 11:51 pm              Quote:    I can't tell if Love of Kill is trying to be an edgy romantic comedy with hitmen or some kind of mystery show set in a dark, unforgiving society.            Having read some fantranslated chapters of the source manga, I'd say it's both. It's a mix of dark mystery, edgy romance, sinister dealings and brief comedic moments.   Even the magazine it publishes in,Monthly Comic Gene, is a demographic-defying magazine that mainly features shonen-themed stories marketed for female readers.      Back to top                  Mami-kouga    Joined: 19 Jan 2021 		    Posts: 86       Posted: Wed Jan 19, 2022 12:48 am            The dissonance is part of the charm I think, but it can get a bit much at some points. As far as questionable romances with rancid guy's go, I'd say raise wa tanin ga ii was a more fun experience for me with an even worse (affectionate) male lead, but love of kill does have a pretty enjoyable mystery-romance blend, it uses the romantic framing to distract the viewers from the more obvious questions about why Song is acting like this.      Back to top                  Gina Szanboti    Joined: 03 Aug 2008 		    Posts: 10216       Posted: Wed Jan 19, 2022 2:10 am            I don't recall much of anything that would lead me to label this a rom-com.  Where was the comedy?  Song was creepy to me off the bat, and his attempts at being light and charming made him even creepier, to hell with framing.  Red flags all over him, even without knowing he's an assassin.  If he came on to me like he did to her (barring the parking garage meeting, which was a 4-alarm category all its own), I'd be looking into a restraining order.   At any rate, I'm totally on board to see what happens.       Back to top                  b-dragon    Joined: 21 Apr 2021 		    Posts: 112       Posted: Wed Jan 19, 2022 1:48 pm            Episode 2 was...better, I think. But I still feel like its held back by Chateau's blank stoicism, and Jim's....well, everything. The latter I've more or less accepted, but I think the former needs to be fixed sooner rather than later.   I'll give it one more episode to do so.      Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Wed Jan 19, 2022 3:33 pm            How many stoic blondes can Saori Onishi play?   I'm kind of curious how much Chateau will get to do since it seems like the main appeal of the series is Song vs. the other assassins and his interest in Chateau. We haven't really gotten a thorough display of how competent/effective she is.      Back to top                  Gina Szanboti    Joined: 03 Aug 2008 		    Posts: 10216       Posted: Thu Jan 20, 2022 3:01 am            She doesn't seem to be competent or effective at all.  I think in every confrontation so far, of every type (except vs her boss), she's lost, hasn't she?      Back to top                  Picky33    Joined: 09 Jul 2021 		    Posts: 215       Posted: Tue Jan 25, 2022 7:12 am              b-dragon wrote:    Episode 2 was...better.          Totally Agree, if i had seen this show at AnimeNYC, i would have no idea what's going on. usually an Anime or Any show in general will try to sell it to you in the first 10-15 mins but after the first episode i had no idea what the plot was supposed to be. i think the first episode should have been a double.      Back to top                  a_Bear_in_Bearcave   Subscriber   Joined: 14 Jan 2019 		    Posts: 281 		    Location: Poland 		        Posted: Tue Jan 25, 2022 11:26 am            I hated that they just killed the girl just after having her locked up with a corpse. If you want to kill off NPCs, just kill them off, or if they suffered enough just let them disappear from the story, don't torture them and then end them brutally anyway. It leaves a bad taste for me, like I'm watching suffering porn "but it's OK since they're not the main characters".   I like the look and design of the main characters, but they are too one-note so far, and the India guy without face is super annoying instead of funny. I'm gonna drop out form this series and catch up on other stuff.      Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Tue Jan 25, 2022 11:51 am              Gina Szanboti wrote:    She doesn't seem to be competent or effective at all.  I think in every confrontation so far, of every type (except vs her boss), she's lost, hasn't she?           Admittedly she was only able to get the drop on Song, although not for long, but she had no way of seeing that truck coming.      Back to top                  Penrhos    Joined: 09 Jun 2021 		    Posts: 86       Posted: Tue Jan 25, 2022 12:41 pm            Well that episode was underwhelming in every way,,,,   I'm past caring about either of the MC's and they'll probably end up being taken out by their respective bosses anyway - so this is a drop from me....      Back to top                  Gina Szanboti    Joined: 03 Aug 2008 		    Posts: 10216       Posted: Tue Jan 25, 2022 1:21 pm              MFrontier wrote:    Admittedly she was only able to get the drop on Song, although not for long           I don't see that as counting, since getting the drop on him was the start of the confrontation. By the end of it, she'd lost.   I also wasn't impressed by her reaction to the truck.  I'd expect better driving skills from someone in her profession, even with a blown tire.  But that was technically the end of her first confrontation with the motorcycle assassin anyway, so it's still another loss -- one compounded by losing to him again in round two.   Ok, maybe I'm being a little hard on her, but women who fall down while being chased, which in entertainment media is like, all of them, always put me in a cranky mood.     I think I'm still not clear about that whole thing.  Why did spiderweb guy go after her with apparently deadly intent in the first place, and then not kill her (or the truck driver) later?  He already knew about Song's interest in her before he first shot at her.  If his intent was to kill her passenger, I don't know why.  I'm not even sure why he'd want to kill Chateau anyway.  It wouldn't get him any closer to Song.      Back to top                  chex mix    Joined: 28 Mar 2015 		    Posts: 395       Posted: Tue Jan 25, 2022 9:20 pm              Gina Szanboti wrote:       Ok, maybe I'm being a little hard on her, but women who fall down while being chased, which in entertainment media is like, all of them, always put me in a cranky mood.    .              The whole "girls can't run without falling down" thing is one of my most hated tropes. It's insulting and never adds anything new or interesting to the chase scenes.      Back to top                  Mami-kouga    Joined: 19 Jan 2021 		    Posts: 86       Posted: Wed Jan 26, 2022 2:19 am            This story does have an issue with spoiler[ Chateau constantly not being able to resolve fights on her own and having to be rescued in the end and that's never going to get better. It's one of my main criticisms of the manga even if she's got some decent moments and it makes me wish they hadn't had her as a hitman at the start (even if she was a newbie) since her being a civilian with maybe some gun training but no on field experience would make her clumsiness more understandable]   That being said, faulting her for not being top form when she was abruptly jumped by a stranger and survived getting truck'd off a cliff is kind of odd.      Back to top                  Gina Szanboti    Joined: 03 Aug 2008 		    Posts: 10216       Posted: Wed Jan 26, 2022 2:35 am            Well, the guy chasing her had just been smashed against a rockface by a ton of skidding steel and then had to make his way down the cliff to get to her, and yet he never fell down while catching up to her.  ¯\_(ツ)_/¯      Back to top                  Mami-kouga    Joined: 19 Jan 2021 		    Posts: 86       Posted: Wed Jan 26, 2022 4:14 pm            Barrelling off a cliff still seems worse to me, but maybe that's just me. REVIEW: Love of Kill            Goto page 1, 2, 3  Next Note: this is the discussion thread for this article     Anime News Network Forum Index -> Site-related -> Talkback    View previous topic :: View next topic     Author Message        zztop    Joined: 28 Aug 2014 		    Posts: 560       Posted: Tue Jan 18, 2022 11:51 pm              Quote:    I can't tell if Love of Kill is trying to be an edgy romantic comedy with hitmen or some kind of mystery show set in a dark, unforgiving society.            Having read some fantranslated chapters of the source manga, I'd say it's both. It's a mix of dark mystery, edgy romance, sinister dealings and brief comedic moments.   Even the magazine it publishes in,Monthly Comic Gene, is a demographic-defying magazine that mainly features shonen-themed stories marketed for female readers.      Back to top                  Mami-kouga    Joined: 19 Jan 2021 		    Posts: 86       Posted: Wed Jan 19, 2022 12:48 am            The dissonance is part of the charm I think, but it can get a bit much at some points. As far as questionable romances with rancid guy's go, I'd say raise wa tanin ga ii was a more fun experience for me with an even worse (affectionate) male lead, but love of kill does have a pretty enjoyable mystery-romance blend, it uses the romantic framing to distract the viewers from the more obvious questions about why Song is acting like this.      Back to top                  Gina Szanboti    Joined: 03 Aug 2008 		    Posts: 10216       Posted: Wed Jan 19, 2022 2:10 am            I don't recall much of anything that would lead me to label this a rom-com.  Where was the comedy?  Song was creepy to me off the bat, and his attempts at being light and charming made him even creepier, to hell with framing.  Red flags all over him, even without knowing he's an assassin.  If he came on to me like he did to her (barring the parking garage meeting, which was a 4-alarm category all its own), I'd be looking into a restraining order.   At any rate, I'm totally on board to see what happens.       Back to top                  b-dragon    Joined: 21 Apr 2021 		    Posts: 112       Posted: Wed Jan 19, 2022 1:48 pm            Episode 2 was...better, I think. But I still feel like its held back by Chateau's blank stoicism, and Jim's....well, everything. The latter I've more or less accepted, but I think the former needs to be fixed sooner rather than later.   I'll give it one more episode to do so.      Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Wed Jan 19, 2022 3:33 pm            How many stoic blondes can Saori Onishi play?   I'm kind of curious how much Chateau will get to do since it seems like the main appeal of the series is Song vs. the other assassins and his interest in Chateau. We haven't really gotten a thorough display of how competent/effective she is.      Back to top                  Gina Szanboti    Joined: 03 Aug 2008 		    Posts: 10216       Posted: Thu Jan 20, 2022 3:01 am            She doesn't seem to be competent or effective at all.  I think in every confrontation so far, of every type (except vs her boss), she's lost, hasn't she?      Back to top                  Picky33    Joined: 09 Jul 2021 		    Posts: 215       Posted: Tue Jan 25, 2022 7:12 am              b-dragon wrote:    Episode 2 was...better.          Totally Agree, if i had seen this show at AnimeNYC, i would have no idea what's going on. usually an Anime or Any show in general will try to sell it to you in the first 10-15 mins but after the first episode i had no idea what the plot was supposed to be. i think the first episode should have been a double.      Back to top                  a_Bear_in_Bearcave   Subscriber   Joined: 14 Jan 2019 		    Posts: 281 		    Location: Poland 		        Posted: Tue Jan 25, 2022 11:26 am            I hated that they just killed the girl just after having her locked up with a corpse. If you want to kill off NPCs, just kill them off, or if they suffered enough just let them disappear from the story, don't torture them and then end them brutally anyway. It leaves a bad taste for me, like I'm watching suffering porn "but it's OK since they're not the main characters".   I like the look and design of the main characters, but they are too one-note so far, and the India guy without face is super annoying instead of funny. I'm gonna drop out form this series and catch up on other stuff.      Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Tue Jan 25, 2022 11:51 am              Gina Szanboti wrote:    She doesn't seem to be competent or effective at all.  I think in every confrontation so far, of every type (except vs her boss), she's lost, hasn't she?           Admittedly she was only able to get the drop on Song, although not for long, but she had no way of seeing that truck coming.      Back to top                  Penrhos    Joined: 09 Jun 2021 		    Posts: 86       Posted: Tue Jan 25, 2022 12:41 pm            Well that episode was underwhelming in every way,,,,   I'm past caring about either of the MC's and they'll probably end up being taken out by their respective bosses anyway - so this is a drop from me....      Back to top                  Gina Szanboti    Joined: 03 Aug 2008 		    Posts: 10216       Posted: Tue Jan 25, 2022 1:21 pm              MFrontier wrote:    Admittedly she was only able to get the drop on Song, although not for long           I don't see that as counting, since getting the drop on him was the start of the confrontation. By the end of it, she'd lost.   I also wasn't impressed by her reaction to the truck.  I'd expect better driving skills from someone in her profession, even with a blown tire.  But that was technically the end of her first confrontation with the motorcycle assassin anyway, so it's still another loss -- one compounded by losing to him again in round two.   Ok, maybe I'm being a little hard on her, but women who fall down while being chased, which in entertainment media is like, all of them, always put me in a cranky mood.     I think I'm still not clear about that whole thing.  Why did spiderweb guy go after her with apparently deadly intent in the first place, and then not kill her (or the truck driver) later?  He already knew about Song's interest in her before he first shot at her.  If his intent was to kill her passenger, I don't know why.  I'm not even sure why he'd want to kill Chateau anyway.  It wouldn't get him any closer to Song.      Back to top                  chex mix    Joined: 28 Mar 2015 		    Posts: 395       Posted: Tue Jan 25, 2022 9:20 pm              Gina Szanboti wrote:       Ok, maybe I'm being a little hard on her, but women who fall down while being chased, which in entertainment media is like, all of them, always put me in a cranky mood.    .              The whole "girls can't run without falling down" thing is one of my most hated tropes. It's insulting and never adds anything new or interesting to the chase scenes.      Back to top                  Mami-kouga    Joined: 19 Jan 2021 		    Posts: 86       Posted: Wed Jan 26, 2022 2:19 am            This story does have an issue with spoiler[ Chateau constantly not being able to resolve fights on her own and having to be rescued in the end and that's never going to get better. It's one of my main criticisms of the manga even if she's got some decent moments and it makes me wish they hadn't had her as a hitman at the start (even if she was a newbie) since her being a civilian with maybe some gun training but no on field experience would make her clumsiness more understandable]   That being said, faulting her for not being top form when she was abruptly jumped by a stranger and survived getting truck'd off a cliff is kind of odd.      Back to top                  Gina Szanboti    Joined: 03 Aug 2008 		    Posts: 10216       Posted: Wed Jan 26, 2022 2:35 am            Well, the guy chasing her had just been smashed against a rockface by a ton of skidding steel and then had to make his way down the cliff to get to her, and yet he never fell down while catching up to her.  ¯\_(ツ)_/¯      Back to top                  Mami-kouga    Joined: 19 Jan 2021 		    Posts: 86       Posted: Wed Jan 26, 2022 4:14 pm            Barrelling off a cliff still seems worse to me, but maybe that's just me. REVIEW: Love of Kill            Goto page 1, 2, 3  Next Note: this is the discussion thread for this article     Anime News Network Forum Index -> Site-related -> Talkback    View previous topic :: View next topic     Author Message        zztop    Joined: 28 Aug 2014 		    Posts: 560       Posted: Tue Jan 18, 2022 11:51 pm              Quote:    I can't tell if Love of Kill is trying to be an edgy romantic comedy with hitmen or some kind of mystery show set in a dark, unforgiving society.            Having read some fantranslated chapters of the source manga, I'd say it's both. It's a mix of dark mystery, edgy romance, sinister dealings and brief comedic moments.   Even the magazine it publishes in,Monthly Comic Gene, is a demographic-defying magazine that mainly features shonen-themed stories marketed for female readers.      Back to top                  Mami-kouga    Joined: 19 Jan 2021 		    Posts: 86       Posted: Wed Jan 19, 2022 12:48 am            The dissonance is part of the charm I think, but it can get a bit much at some points. As far as questionable romances with rancid guy's go, I'd say raise wa tanin ga ii was a more fun experience for me with an even worse (affectionate) male lead, but love of kill does have a pretty enjoyable mystery-romance blend, it uses the romantic framing to distract the viewers from the more obvious questions about why Song is acting like this.      Back to top                  Gina Szanboti    Joined: 03 Aug 2008 		    Posts: 10216       Posted: Wed Jan 19, 2022 2:10 am            I don't recall much of anything that would lead me to label this a rom-com.  Where was the comedy?  Song was creepy to me off the bat, and his attempts at being light and charming made him even creepier, to hell with framing.  Red flags all over him, even without knowing he's an assassin.  If he came on to me like he did to her (barring the parking garage meeting, which was a 4-alarm category all its own), I'd be looking into a restraining order.   At any rate, I'm totally on board to see what happens.       Back to top                  b-dragon    Joined: 21 Apr 2021 		    Posts: 112       Posted: Wed Jan 19, 2022 1:48 pm            Episode 2 was...better, I think. But I still feel like its held back by Chateau's blank stoicism, and Jim's....well, everything. The latter I've more or less accepted, but I think the former needs to be fixed sooner rather than later.   I'll give it one more episode to do so.      Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Wed Jan 19, 2022 3:33 pm            How many stoic blondes can Saori Onishi play?   I'm kind of curious how much Chateau will get to do since it seems like the main appeal of the series is Song vs. the other assassins and his interest in Chateau. We haven't really gotten a thorough display of how competent/effective she is.      Back to top                  Gina Szanboti    Joined: 03 Aug 2008 		    Posts: 10216       Posted: Thu Jan 20, 2022 3:01 am            She doesn't seem to be competent or effective at all.  I think in every confrontation so far, of every type (except vs her boss), she's lost, hasn't she?      Back to top                  Picky33    Joined: 09 Jul 2021 		    Posts: 215       Posted: Tue Jan 25, 2022 7:12 am              b-dragon wrote:    Episode 2 was...better.          Totally Agree, if i had seen this show at AnimeNYC, i would have no idea what's going on. usually an Anime or Any show in general will try to sell it to you in the first 10-15 mins but after the first episode i had no idea what the plot was supposed to be. i think the first episode should have been a double.      Back to top                  a_Bear_in_Bearcave   Subscriber   Joined: 14 Jan 2019 		    Posts: 281 		    Location: Poland 		        Posted: Tue Jan 25, 2022 11:26 am            I hated that they just killed the girl just after having her locked up with a corpse. If you want to kill off NPCs, just kill them off, or if they suffered enough just let them disappear from the story, don't torture them and then end them brutally anyway. It leaves a bad taste for me, like I'm watching suffering porn "but it's OK since they're not the main characters".   I like the look and design of the main characters, but they are too one-note so far, and the India guy without face is super annoying instead of funny. I'm gonna drop out form this series and catch up on other stuff.      Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Tue Jan 25, 2022 11:51 am              Gina Szanboti wrote:    She doesn't seem to be competent or effective at all.  I think in every confrontation so far, of every type (except vs her boss), she's lost, hasn't she?           Admittedly she was only able to get the drop on Song, although not for long, but she had no way of seeing that truck coming.      Back to top                  Penrhos    Joined: 09 Jun 2021 		    Posts: 86       Posted: Tue Jan 25, 2022 12:41 pm            Well that episode was underwhelming in every way,,,,   I'm past caring about either of the MC's and they'll probably end up being taken out by their respective bosses anyway - so this is a drop from me....      Back to top                  Gina Szanboti    Joined: 03 Aug 2008 		    Posts: 10216       Posted: Tue Jan 25, 2022 1:21 pm              MFrontier wrote:    Admittedly she was only able to get the drop on Song, although not for long           I don't see that as counting, since getting the drop on him was the start of the confrontation. By the end of it, she'd lost.   I also wasn't impressed by her reaction to the truck.  I'd expect better driving skills from someone in her profession, even with a blown tire.  But that was technically the end of her first confrontation with the motorcycle assassin anyway, so it's still another loss -- one compounded by losing to him again in round two.   Ok, maybe I'm being a little hard on her, but women who fall down while being chased, which in entertainment media is like, all of them, always put me in a cranky mood.     I think I'm still not clear about that whole thing.  Why did spiderweb guy go after her with apparently deadly intent in the first place, and then not kill her (or the truck driver) later?  He already knew about Song's interest in her before he first shot at her.  If his intent was to kill her passenger, I don't know why.  I'm not even sure why he'd want to kill Chateau anyway.  It wouldn't get him any closer to Song.      Back to top                  chex mix    Joined: 28 Mar 2015 		    Posts: 395       Posted: Tue Jan 25, 2022 9:20 pm              Gina Szanboti wrote:       Ok, maybe I'm being a little hard on her, but women who fall down while being chased, which in entertainment media is like, all of them, always put me in a cranky mood.    .              The whole "girls can't run without falling down" thing is one of my most hated tropes. It's insulting and never adds anything new or interesting to the chase scenes.      Back to top                  Mami-kouga    Joined: 19 Jan 2021 		    Posts: 86       Posted: Wed Jan 26, 2022 2:19 am            This story does have an issue with spoiler[ Chateau constantly not being able to resolve fights on her own and having to be rescued in the end and that's never going to get better. It's one of my main criticisms of the manga even if she's got some decent moments and it makes me wish they hadn't had her as a hitman at the start (even if she was a newbie) since her being a civilian with maybe some gun training but no on field experience would make her clumsiness more understandable]   That being said, faulting her for not being top form when she was abruptly jumped by a stranger and survived getting truck'd off a cliff is kind of odd.      Back to top                  Gina Szanboti    Joined: 03 Aug 2008 		    Posts: 10216       Posted: Wed Jan 26, 2022 2:35 am            Well, the guy chasing her had just been smashed against a rockface by a ton of skidding steel and then had to make his way down the cliff to get to her, and yet he never fell down while catching up to her.  ¯\_(ツ)_/¯      Back to top                  Mami-kouga    Joined: 19 Jan 2021 		    Posts: 86       Posted: Wed Jan 26, 2022 4:14 pm            Barrelling off a cliff still seems worse to me, but maybe that's just me. Title: EP. REVIEW: Love of Kill [1/3] - Forum - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: ×  remind me tomorrow remind me next week never remind me      Subscribe to the ANN Newsletter • Wake up every Sunday to a curated list of ANN's most interesting posts of the week.    read more           ข่าวสารและบทความของ Anime News Network ในรูปแบบภาษาไทย สามารถติดตามอ่านได้แล้วที่ DEXclub         กรุณาเข้าไปเยี่ยมชมได้ที่ news.dexclub.com เพื่อติดตามอ่านข่าวสารล่าสุดในรูปแบบภาษาไทย          Anime News Network's news and articles are available in Thai from DEXclub.         Visit news.dexclub.com for all the latest news in Thai.              Forum - View topicEP. REVIEW: Love of Kill            Goto page 1, 2, 3  Next Note: this is the discussion thread for this article     Anime News Network Forum Index -> Site-related -> Talkback    View previous topic :: View next topic     Author Message        zztop    Joined: 28 Aug 2014 		    Posts: 560       Posted: Tue Jan 18, 2022 11:51 pm              Quote:    I can't tell if Love of Kill is trying to be an edgy romantic comedy with hitmen or some kind of mystery show set in a dark, unforgiving society.            Having read some fantranslated chapters of the source manga, I'd say it's both. It's a mix of dark mystery, edgy romance, sinister dealings and brief comedic moments.   Even the magazine it publishes in,Monthly Comic Gene, is a demographic-defying magazine that mainly features shonen-themed stories marketed for female readers.      Back to top                  Mami-kouga    Joined: 19 Jan 2021 		    Posts: 86       Posted: Wed Jan 19, 2022 12:48 am            The dissonance is part of the charm I think, but it can get a bit much at some points. As far as questionable romances with rancid guy's go, I'd say raise wa tanin ga ii was a more fun experience for me with an even worse (affectionate) male lead, but love of kill does have a pretty enjoyable mystery-romance blend, it uses the romantic framing to distract the viewers from the more obvious questions about why Song is acting like this.      Back to top                  Gina Szanboti    Joined: 03 Aug 2008 		    Posts: 10216       Posted: Wed Jan 19, 2022 2:10 am            I don't recall much of anything that would lead me to label this a rom-com.  Where was the comedy?  Song was creepy to me off the bat, and his attempts at being light and charming made him even creepier, to hell with framing.  Red flags all over him, even without knowing he's an assassin.  If he came on to me like he did to her (barring the parking garage meeting, which was a 4-alarm category all its own), I'd be looking into a restraining order.   At any rate, I'm totally on board to see what happens.       Back to top                  b-dragon    Joined: 21 Apr 2021 		    Posts: 112       Posted: Wed Jan 19, 2022 1:48 pm            Episode 2 was...better, I think. But I still feel like its held back by Chateau's blank stoicism, and Jim's....well, everything. The latter I've more or less accepted, but I think the former needs to be fixed sooner rather than later.   I'll give it one more episode to do so.      Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Wed Jan 19, 2022 3:33 pm            How many stoic blondes can Saori Onishi play?   I'm kind of curious how much Chateau will get to do since it seems like the main appeal of the series is Song vs. the other assassins and his interest in Chateau. We haven't really gotten a thorough display of how competent/effective she is.      Back to top                  Gina Szanboti    Joined: 03 Aug 2008 		    Posts: 10216       Posted: Thu Jan 20, 2022 3:01 am            She doesn't seem to be competent or effective at all.  I think in every confrontation so far, of every type (except vs her boss), she's lost, hasn't she?      Back to top                  Picky33    Joined: 09 Jul 2021 		    Posts: 215       Posted: Tue Jan 25, 2022 7:12 am              b-dragon wrote:    Episode 2 was...better.          Totally Agree, if i had seen this show at AnimeNYC, i would have no idea what's going on. usually an Anime or Any show in general will try to sell it to you in the first 10-15 mins but after the first episode i had no idea what the plot was supposed to be. i think the first episode should have been a double.      Back to top                  a_Bear_in_Bearcave   Subscriber   Joined: 14 Jan 2019 		    Posts: 281 		    Location: Poland 		        Posted: Tue Jan 25, 2022 11:26 am            I hated that they just killed the girl just after having her locked up with a corpse. If you want to kill off NPCs, just kill them off, or if they suffered enough just let them disappear from the story, don't torture them and then end them brutally anyway. It leaves a bad taste for me, like I'm watching suffering porn "but it's OK since they're not the main characters".   I like the look and design of the main characters, but they are too one-note so far, and the India guy without face is super annoying instead of funny. I'm gonna drop out form this series and catch up on other stuff.      Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Tue Jan 25, 2022 11:51 am              Gina Szanboti wrote:    She doesn't seem to be competent or effective at all.  I think in every confrontation so far, of every type (except vs her boss), she's lost, hasn't she?           Admittedly she was only able to get the drop on Song, although not for long, but she had no way of seeing that truck coming.      Back to top                  Penrhos    Joined: 09 Jun 2021 		    Posts: 86       Posted: Tue Jan 25, 2022 12:41 pm            Well that episode was underwhelming in every way,,,,   I'm past caring about either of the MC's and they'll probably end up being taken out by their respective bosses anyway - so this is a drop from me....      Back to top                  Gina Szanboti    Joined: 03 Aug 2008 		    Posts: 10216       Posted: Tue Jan 25, 2022 1:21 pm              MFrontier wrote:    Admittedly she was only able to get the drop on Song, although not for long           I don't see that as counting, since getting the drop on him was the start of the confrontation. By the end of it, she'd lost.   I also wasn't impressed by her reaction to the truck.  I'd expect better driving skills from someone in her profession, even with a blown tire.  But that was technically the end of her first confrontation with the motorcycle assassin anyway, so it's still another loss -- one compounded by losing to him again in round two.   Ok, maybe I'm being a little hard on her, but women who fall down while being chased, which in entertainment media is like, all of them, always put me in a cranky mood.     I think I'm still not clear about that whole thing.  Why did spiderweb guy go after her with apparently deadly intent in the first place, and then not kill her (or the truck driver) later?  He already knew about Song's interest in her before he first shot at her.  If his intent was to kill her passenger, I don't know why.  I'm not even sure why he'd want to kill Chateau anyway.  It wouldn't get him any closer to Song.      Back to top                  chex mix    Joined: 28 Mar 2015 		    Posts: 395       Posted: Tue Jan 25, 2022 9:20 pm              Gina Szanboti wrote:       Ok, maybe I'm being a little hard on her, but women who fall down while being chased, which in entertainment media is like, all of them, always put me in a cranky mood.    .              The whole "girls can't run without falling down" thing is one of my most hated tropes. It's insulting and never adds anything new or interesting to the chase scenes.      Back to top                  Mami-kouga    Joined: 19 Jan 2021 		    Posts: 86       Posted: Wed Jan 26, 2022 2:19 am            This story does have an issue with spoiler[ Chateau constantly not being able to resolve fights on her own and having to be rescued in the end and that's never going to get better. It's one of my main criticisms of the manga even if she's got some decent moments and it makes me wish they hadn't had her as a hitman at the start (even if she was a newbie) since her being a civilian with maybe some gun training but no on field experience would make her clumsiness more understandable]   That being said, faulting her for not being top form when she was abruptly jumped by a stranger and survived getting truck'd off a cliff is kind of odd.      Back to top                  Gina Szanboti    Joined: 03 Aug 2008 		    Posts: 10216       Posted: Wed Jan 26, 2022 2:35 am            Well, the guy chasing her had just been smashed against a rockface by a ton of skidding steel and then had to make his way down the cliff to get to her, and yet he never fell down while catching up to her.  ¯\_(ツ)_/¯      Back to top                  Mami-kouga    Joined: 19 Jan 2021 		    Posts: 86       Posted: Wed Jan 26, 2022 4:14 pm            Barrelling off a cliff still seems worse to me, but maybe that's just me.
